text: Raymond James Cranch (born January 1923) is a New Zealand former rugby league footballer who represented New Zealand. ==Playing career== A member of the Mount Albert Lions, Cranch represented Auckland.History mtalbertlions.co.nz He captained Auckland in 1950. Cranch was selected for New Zealand in 1951-52 but did not play in any test matches. Cranch also played softball and was involved with the Piha Surf Life Saving Club. ==Later years== Cranch was later the manager of the Auckland side and in 1973 he was a selector.Coffey, John and Bernie Wood Auckland, 100 years of rugby league, 1909-2009, 2009. . Cranch is a life member of both the Auckland Rugby League and New Zealand Rugby League.life members nzrl.co.nz In the 2006 Queen's Birthday Honours, Cranch was appointed a Member of the New Zealand Order of Merit, for services to sport, especially rugby league. Born in January 1923, Cranich is the oldest living former Kiwis player. ==References== Category:1923 births Category:Living people Category:New Zealand rugby league players Category:New Zealand rugby league administrators Category:New Zealand national rugby league team players Category:Auckland rugby league team players Category:Rugby league props Category:Mount Albert Lions players Category:New Zealand softball players Category:Members of the New Zealand Order of Merit Category:Place of birth missing (living people) Category:Date of birth missing (living people)
title: Ray Cranch
